document.discussion_title: Bobby Kennedy: The Making Of A Liberal Icon
document.topic_text: By Mark Heyne • 5 minutes ago Share Larry Tye's new book tells of Robert F. Kennedy's transformation from cold warrior to liberal icon. Robert F. Kennedy is remembered as a racial healer, a defender of the poor and a progressive champion of the Sixties. But Kennedy's political journey began in the conservative Fifties. In his new book, "Bobby Kennedy: The Making of a Liberal Icon," author Larry Tye chronicles Kennedy's transformation from cold warrior – he began his public life as counsel to the red-baiting senator Joseph McCarthy – into fiery liberal. We spoke with Larry Tye about Robert Kennedy's life. Related Program:
